intro: Samadera indica, commonly known as Indian sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
